title: Agent-Driven VS Code Extension Development
description:
Enable Claude to effectively develop and debug VS Code extensions through browser automation and MCP integration.

Goals:
- Run VS Code in a browser (code-server or VS Code Web) with locally-built extensions
- Control VS Code via MCP (Browser MCP, Chrome DevTools MCP, or Playwright)
- Access debugging tools: screenshots, logs, inspector, terminal output
- Enable human participation via VNC/X11 for guidance and review

Success criteria:
- Claude can start/stop VS Code, reload extensions, run commands
- Claude can see UI state, logs, and errors programmatically
- Jason can observe and guide Claude's actions in real-time

1. **Submenu indicators missing**: When clicking the filter menu, it's not clear that the first menu item leads to submenus. There should be visual treatment (arrow/chevron) to indicate there's another menu before a selection is made.

2. **Dismiss behavior**: The filter button requires multiple clicks to dismiss if you were just looking. Should dismiss as soon as the user clicks away from the menu (standard click-outside-to-close behavior).

title: Filter presets/favorites system for Issues panel
description: Currently filtering requires manually adding multiple filters (e.g., Open + In Progress + Blocked to exclude Closed). Need a better UX for common filter combinations.
design:
**Options considered:**

1. **Preset filters** - Built-in presets like "Not Closed", "Active Work"
   - Simple UX, covers common cases
   - Limited flexibility

2. **Negated filters** - Click to toggle +/- on any filter
   - Full flexibility
   - More complex UX, needs visual indicator

3. **Default filter** - Start with a filter applied (e.g., "Not Closed")
   - Good for most common use case
   - User can clear if needed

**Recommended approach:**
Combination of 1 + 3: Filter "favorites" dropdown that preconfigures filter sets.
- Start with static built-in favorites: "Not Closed", "Active" (in_progress + blocked), "All"
- Future: Allow saving custom filter sets as favorites
- Default to "Not Closed" on load

design:

2. Ensure backend passes through dependents from bd show
3. Add "Dependents" section to BeadDetails.tsx (similar to "Depends On")
4. Make dependent badges clickable to navigate to that issue

title: Markdown rendering has excessive spacing around lists

title: Fix bd sync prefix mismatch (vscode-beads- vs vscode-)
description: bd sync fails with: "prefix mismatch detected: database uses 'vscode-beads-' but found issues with prefixes: [vscode- (16 issues)]". This prevents syncing beads to git.
design:
Error suggests using --rename-on-import flag. May need to:
1. Run bd sync --rename-on-import
2. Or fix the prefix in config.yaml
3. Or re-export with correct prefix
notes:
**Root Cause:** Bug in `internal/utils/issue_id.go:ExtractIssuePrefix` - used `strings.Index` (first hyphen) instead of `strings.LastIndex` (last hyphen). For `vscode-beads-4n2`, it extracted prefix as `vscode` instead of `vscode-beads`.

**Fix:** Already in beads main (commit 6294ef0c). New bd built at `/tmp/bd-new`.

**Workaround Applied:** Renamed prefix from `vscode-beads` to `vsbeads`.

title: viewContainer/title buttons not showing in BEADS header
description: Configured beads.switchProject and beads.refresh commands in viewContainer/title menu with `when: viewContainer == beads`, but no buttons appear in the BEADS header. Only the [...] overflow menu shows.
design:
VS Code does not support extension-contributed inline buttons in viewContainer title bars. The `viewContainer/title` menu contribution point only adds items to the overflow/context menu.

This is confirmed by microsoft/vscode#74221 which was closed as out-of-scope.
notes:
**Finding:** This is a VS Code platform limitation, not a bug in our extension.

Per [microsoft/vscode#74221](https://github.com/microsoft/vscode/issues/74221):
- Built-in view containers (Run and Debug, Search) can have title bar buttons
- Extension view containers can ONLY add to overflow menu (...)
- Feature request was rejected as "out-of-scope"

**Current workaround:** Use `view/title` to add buttons to individual view headers (e.g., Issues panel title bar) instead of the container title bar.

**Status:** Won't fix - VS Code limitation
